reviewText:
Teddy Floppy Ear - Kayaking is a cute game for the whole family. Intended for kids, i found it rather enjoyable too with the graphics and the funny dialogs. I work as a kindergarten teacher, and i could see this game at the pre-school.

The Story
Teddy is going on a picnic with his friend Piglet. Piglet is grabbing his bike and Teddy (the player) grabs a kayak.
While on the river Teddy notices that some things are wrong, and tries to help.

Pros
- Nice graphics and funny dialogues.
- Memorable and cute characters.
- Funny minigames that suits children from about 3 years and up. (Some puzzles might be tough for small children).

Cons
- I noticed some small glitches in dialogues, but its nothing big.
- Rather short adventure, aprox 1.5 hours of clear time. (But could be a good thing though for children)

Conclusion
A rather enjoyable little adventure even for me as adult. I can definately recommend this for folks with children.
I think they will enjoy this game.

reviewText: Although the game is kind of  short (about an hour of game play), it is simply adorable (coming from a 19 years old). Playing this game takes me back to my childhood, when my parents read me good night stories about bears and the living in the forest. A kids game? Sure. Does that mean you won't like it regardless your age? Heck no (unless you hate bears and other animals living in the farm and forest [if that's the case, then gtfo]). The mini games are alright.\n\nGot banned on CS GO? You should defenetly play this (not that it has happened to me xD). Get your mind away from those afk players, auto snipers, and Kobe" kills. This game is way better and relaxing than anything else; better than Dota

reviewText:
Caught it on sale for about $2, so, I mean, I couldn't beat that.
Ny nephew fell in love with it and my niece was captivated watching him play it.

He didn't get all the puzzles--he's easily frustrated and that whole idea of failing being the worse thing you do in your life is being engraved in his head from school already--, but he really enjoyed the game.

It is very colorful, easy to use with click and point control, and the story is pretty simple. The only thing I didn't like about it was the whole quest run-around that went on. I know it adds to the journey experience or whatever, but I'm not a fan of questing on most games I play lol. But it's not about me, its for the kid, and the kid loved it.

9/10

reviewText: How do you go back to a casual shooter like Counter-Strike after doing competitive speed runs of Teddy Floppy Ear - Kayaking? The hours spent trying to find glitches to jump ahead and save time. Whoever designed this game paid excruciating detail to the coding. It's flawless. No bugs or glitches. It has everything an award winning game needs. Striking visuals, insane graphics, and a deep background on every character that binds you emotionally to the game. I'd be hard pressed to find someone who has not been touched by this masterpiece. I used to be an addict before Teddy Floppy Ear - Kayaking. Now I'm not. Some people think Bush did 9/11, but im pretty sure the slow worm had something to do with it. He is a reptile of course. And reptiles cannot be trusted. Also the Heron could get it.\n\n10/10

reviewText:
I must confess that I was completely absorbed in Teddy's epic river saga and his fight against the oppressive and tyrannical  rule of dictator Catfish. I further must admit that I was stationed, glued to the edge of my seat, with all nails bitten off when Teddy had to face Catfish's evil henchmen the mosquitoes and rescue several garden nuts. Im also ashamed to admit that I was even willing to pee into an empty bottle unwilling to leave my screen when Teddy had to act as a negotiator between two warring factions farmer and worm, in order to bring peace to the strawberry fields from the snail infestation and global epidemic.

In fact Teddy Floppy Ears is such a PERFECT bundle of charisma that those who are looking for the return of Christ might not need to look any more. Yes teddy is that PERFECT!!!

Teddy Floppy Ears and the retelling of his Kayak adventure has been mistakened by many to be only for children of a young age, whose parents are also looking for a teaching icon and tool to help instill in their children favorable traits and characteristics. While it is true that Teddy spends most of his time returning the river to its peaceful state he also shares profound truths and wisdom and sayings, particularly that one should ask before borrowing something and that order demands tidiness.

In fact if it was not for my room-mate this morning causing a power surge because he had an accident with an iron, I may have even missed church this morning. That is how HOLY this experience was for me. Big plans to erect a Teddy Floppy Ears shrine in my bedroom is now up and running, and a new cult following has now begun...

reviewText:
Best game I have played in a long time
A hidden triple A gem that rises far above the mediocrity found on steam

The game's difficulty level is about equal to Dark Souls, though smoother.
You play a ferocious bear out to rescue the world from the evil Piglet who is always one step ahead of you wiht his bicycle whilst you're stuck in your kayak, though with your trusty peddle as your weapon of choice you set out in pursuit.

Interesting character developements and intrigue guaranteed on a Game of Thrones story telling level.
Even up to a very dark and grim ending that'll shake you to your core.

10/10 Would Bear through again.

reviewText:
Never in my entire life have I enjoyed a game as much as this one. The STORYTELLING MAN!!!! IT IS ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL!! I CRIED SO HARD AT THE ENDING!

Ok let's start reviewing this game

Story 10/10
Yes, I'm giving this a 10. Why? Well it shouldn't even be a question in the first place. It's pretty obvious why I'm giving the story a 10. The game feels so real and the storytelling in this game is amazing. What happened to Teddy could happen to anyone in real life. I'm not going to spoil any more but let's just say that I shed a few tears.

Characters 10/10
Yes, also a 10. Teddy is probably the first character I've seen in a game that had this much character development. He feels unique and real. A Teddy might be walking around your own school.

Music 10/10
OOOoooh where do I even begin!!! Such nostalgic and epic music! I loved the OST's, especially during the fights.

This pretty much sums up my review. I hope you will all buy this amazing game. Can't recommend it enough. People in my class tell me it's a kids game, but they don't know what they are talking about.
voteText: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
While Mountain Adventure and Racing where so bad they were good, Kayaking is just plain old bad.

New rule: never ever do a point and click game in a kayak or canoe or any other paddeling operated boat again unless it controlls with WASD/arrow keys. While mountain adventure controlled fine enough even if somewhat glitchy and slow, the controls in this one feels very sluggish, unresponsive and at times downright doing the opposite of what you tell them to.

On top of the abysmal controls we have the issue of the story and missions also being much worse than in mountain adventure. EVERYTHING in the game is a sidequest, even the main story, and it has an unreasonable ammount of backtracking, presumably so they wouldn't have to produce more background art for new locations.

Instead of having a somewhat decently sized area to explore, we now have tons of very very bad mini games that control worse than free Flash games, and will probably have kids with less patience than adults ragequit eventually too.

There is also much less so bad it's good" enjoyment in here in the dialouge itself. Outside of an amusing scene involving random off screen kids berating a cat fish for being poor at math (it makes sense in context... sort of) the dialouge is very plain and the over the top overacting isn't as present or cheesy as in mountain adventure.

Basically
date: I can't recommend this one to adults looking for some cheesy camp value nor kids looking for a fun adventure. Grab the other two Teddy Floppy Ear games instead."

reviewText:
-This game has some bug issues with the loading screen and the ending scene was spazzing out.

-Honestly the characters in this game are moronic and choose to ask you, the player, to fetch things for them because they are too lazy to do it themselves. I'm trying to have a picnic with my pig friend gosh darn it!!

-Also the mini games are about finding and avoiding things. Not a whole lot of innovative ways to make you think a little. +The math puzzle was good.

-The voice acting was awkward and the script laughable. Sometimes your character says unimportant things or inappropriately says goodbye in the middle of a conversation.

-NO ACHIEVEMENTS!!!

-Not a lot of interactable objects or environment.

+The music is AMAZING though! I'd totally buy it!

OVERALL:
Other than that it's a real basic game for 6 year olds at best. Not enough puzzles to help stimulate young minds. Music is great. I bought it for about $2.49 so it's worth it. But FULL PRICE? I wouldn't say so.

reviewText: I had read the previous reviews and bought this game for my kids.  Within 10 minutes of playing a problem arose.  My kids are young and at an age where we are teaching them right from wrong,plus they imitate what they see.    In the game they came to a point where a number of signs were posted blocking the way. A warning sign, an actual STOP sign, and a picture was also shown to them for a reason NOT to continue down that path any further. I was pleased as my kids on thier own decided it was best to follow the signs and not to proceed any further in that direction.  But the game then gave them no alternative but to ignore all the signs and go past them in order to continue playing.  My kids were confused by this. And I was not happy with it either.\nA second incedent was confusing also. The game has puzzles for the kids to supposedly teach them.  The first puzzle they ran into was to match colored frogs to thier respectively colored lily pads.   The game designer should have picked colors that little kids would recognize.  It was confusing trying to teach a kid that a bluish green frog is not a green frog. As it turns out this was not even the worst part as 3 moves into the puzzle the game suddenly had the puzzle disappear and had now proceeded on it's own to place the kids in the kayak further into the game??  A second and 3rd try on the puzzle ended with the same outcome.\nI realize the game did not cost a lot but it has issues in my opinion.

If you're looking for a review you've come to the wrong place, if you're here to cook a pie then read on !
Napoleon from the final puff pastry
You will need:
Ready flaky pastry - 1.5 kg five eggs Flour - 150 g> Sugar - 400 grams Milk - 1200 ml Vanilla sugar - 1 n. Cognac - 1 tbsp. l. Shelled walnuts - glass sequence of preparation: dough defrost naturally at room temperature (defrost time indicated on the package). Cook the custard: grind the egg yolks with a mixer or a whisk to a conventional incandescent and vanilla sugar, flour and brandy to enter the mix. The mixture pour a trickle of milk, stir and cook, stirring constantly. Divide the dough into the desired number of pieces that will later Korzh. Roll out each piece on a board sprinkled with flour. Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes until golden color on a dry baking temperature of 200 degrees. Fluff the cooled cream cakes. If desired, each layer sprinkled with chopped nuts. On top of the cake lightly press smeared with cream and sprinkle all sides crumbs. Add layer cake in a cool place overnight.

reviewText: Teddy Floppy Ear - Kayaking  the sequel to the beloved original Teddy Floppy Ear - Mountain Adventure is back and hits harder than ever with phenomenal gameplay simalr to the likes of GOTY winning telltale games. Teddy Floopy Ear's thrilling pace will give the average gamer goosebumps as they paddle through rushing river water and pick the luscious strawberries straight from the vine. Teddy Floppy Ear is not mad for the weak hearted as this adventure throws you around like a roller coaster ride. I recommend this game only to the hardcore gamers that are ready for a thrill seeking, mind blowing experience that only Teddy Floppy Ear - Kayaking can deliver.

reviewText: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ\nI've played this game with my 3 years old daughter. After Teddy Floppy Ear. Mountain Adventure" I was happy to start another adventure game in the series
date: but the result is really disappointing. "Mountain Adventure" was really nice balanced and it was a pleasure to see my daughter playing without any help. In contrast
recommended: in "Kayaking" the story and quests are not so interesting and minigames are extremely frustrating due to specific physics of kayaking - your enemies and obstacles move fast and your kayak lags heavily; it blends into one of the most frustrating game experience I've ever had. Even the main gameplay (where Teddy is also mostly in kayak) suffers from poor response time
hoursPlayed: slow turning back and difficult maneuvering."
